channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024080024
item.description:
Report E-2024080024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-09T00:38:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: PIONEER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FISHER AUTO PARTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 93767
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The incident report was filed due to spillage of Diesel Fuel from the saddle tank from the power unit. The CMV jackknifed causing the saddle tank to be crush and releasing diesel fuel on the roadway. The driver failed to maintain control of the CMV and struck a guard rail. The roadway was wet and under construction (repaving) and the surface was uneven. No other vehicles were involved and no injuries were reported. A local Hazmat clean-up company (ECOtech, 50 Easy Street, London, KY. 40741) responded to the scene. They tapped the fuel tank and transferred the contents to slow/stop the leak. The materials used were hydrocarbon exsorbent pads, absorbent booms, recovery drum, skid steer, and a dump truck for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080045
item.description:
Report E-2024080045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ML ENERGY TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Circle K notified ERTS of a fuel overfill at a Mapco in Nashville, TN (Circle K bought out Mapco). It was reported that approximately 100 gallons of premium unleaded gasoline released due to the cap coming loose on the veerder-root system (measures the depth of how much fuel in the tank) when they were filling it. He has his lead driver on the way with oil dri, spill pads, and absorbent snakes and the area has been coned off. The release impacted asphalt and has spilled into the roadway, shutting down the Firestone next door. No storm drains or waterways are impacted by the release that he is aware of. He is not aware of any road closures or emergency personnel on site at this time but believes management will be notifying the fire department.

item.title: Report E-2024080002
item.description:
Report E-2024080002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured during loading and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized neutralizer, granular absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024072349
item.description:
Report X-2024072349

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a plastic crate containing a self inflation raft was dropped during the sorting process. The gas cylinder attached to the raft discharge causing the raft to inflate destroying the plastic crate. The raft was deflated and all contents of the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package.

item.title: Report X-2024071974
item.description:
Report X-2024071974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/21/2024 at approximately 1733, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a printing ink spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4-1 gallon plastic jugs. The shipment under the tracking number ending in -9348, was reportedly mishandled, resulting in spillage. The ink from the spill soaked into the labels, destroying all of the pertinent package information. The damaged pacakge was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held for the FAA.
